intro: Calycopteris nutans, commonly known as the nodding calico, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often hairy. Its most distinctive feature is its nodding, yellow-orange flower heads, which consist of numerous small florets. Calycopteris nutans typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
